events.message: Additional test vector for hardened derivation with leading zeros

events.body:
ACK

I've checked that  
91ef8344d4de28b0a659401ef5fefee6c3d9f7ae passes unit and functional tests locally, and the keys used match the proposed update to BIP32 in https://github.com/bitcoin/bips/pull/1030/commits/b0521f076c0b40208e82208f5476c48071aab785.
ACK 91ef8344d4de28b0a659401ef5fefee6c3d9f7ae. Verified that it matches the linked BIP32 update, and that it indeed tests derivation from a private key with leading 0 byte.
